thread.title: 23 Tiny Little Details You Never Noticed In “The Walking Dead”
thread.title_full: 23 Tiny Little Details You Never Noticed In “The Walking Dead”

author: Christopher Hudspeth
title: 23 Tiny Little Details You Never Noticed In “The Walking Dead”
text:
View this image ›
AMC ID: 10734693 2. There’s a creepy face in a tree during the first episode. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10735136 3. Edwin Jenner’s warning to Rick in the Season 1 finale is the title of the Season 7 premiere episode in which Rick and his group meet Negan and reach their low point. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10733700 4. What Merle said while stuck on the roof is the same thing he says right before The Governor kills him. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10734390 5. There’s a Spam knockoff called “SMEAT.” View this image ›
AMC ID: 10734799 6. The Governor stumbled across a beheaded corpse with a sign nailed to it that read “LIAR.” The next episode he says nothing but the word “liar” immediately before beheading Hershel. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10735861 7. The van Daryl and Carol enter that’s teetering on a bridge and has a Virgin Mary statue inside is a reference to a Lost scene, in which Boone enters a plane teetering from high above, filled with Virgin Mary statues. View this image ›
AMC / ABC ID: 10735326 8. In Season 4, Beth and Daryl stumble upon a bunch of bodies being eaten by walkers. Near one of them is a baseball bat wrapped in barbwire, just like Negan’s beloved Lucille. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10736998 9. The guy Rick walks in on in Season 4’s “Claimed” wasn’t using the toilet, he was doing coke. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10735533 10. The clock in Season 4’s “Indifference” reads 4:20. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10735578 11. This shot of The Governor lying on a parrot pillow makes him look like a pirate. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10736873 12. When Tyreese is hallucinating in Season 5’s “What Happened and What’s Going On,” he hears a British voice on the radio. It’s actually Andrew Lincoln speaking. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10736996 13. The man in the red poncho who gets killed by The Wolves is a nod to the fairy tale, Little Red Riding Hood and the Big Bad Wolf . View this image ›
AMC ID: 10741503 14. Since losing his right eye, Carl has switched to shooting with his left hand. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10735110 15. This art hanging behind Morgan in Season 6’s “Last Day on Earth” foreshadows The Kingdom. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10735428 16. The bible verses in Father Gabriel’s church revolve around the dead. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10736981 17. In Season 5’s “Conquer,” Aaron kills a walker with a machete, recreating a shot from Dawn of the Dead . View this image ›
United Film Distribution Company / AMC ID: 10736909 18. Shortly after Enid eats a turtle, Eastman wears a shirt that says “SAVE TERRAPINS.” View this image ›
AMC ID: 10736887 19. Daryl gives Carol a Cherokee rose to make her feel better when Sophia’s missing, then four seasons later, one can be seen on a walker killed by Daryl. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10736945 20. What Morgan says to Rick in the first episode, Rick says back to Morgan when they’re reunited in Season 6. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10741218 21. In Season 7’s “New Best Friends,” something quickly zips by behind Rick and it could’ve been a plane (cool), a UFO (cooler) or a production mistake (not exciting, but feasible). View this image ›
AMC ID: 10734905 22. Rick tells Michonne something very similar to what Glenn told her in the past. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10741919 23. Negan talking about sleeping with widows infuriated Rick on Maggie’s behalf, but it also reminded him of Lori and Shane, whom he discusses with Michonne. View this image ›
AMC ID: 10742240 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
